Package com.example.lotto649.Models

Class EventModel

java.lang.Object
com.example.lotto649.AbstractClasses.AbstractModel
com.example.lotto649.Models.EventModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class EventModel extends AbstractModel implements Serializable
EventModel represents an event in the application with attributes such as title, location, description, number of spots, event type, and poster image. This model class also handles saving and updating event data in Firestore.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • EventModel

      public EventModel()
      No-argument constructor for Firestore deserialization. This constructor is required for creating instances of the `EventModel` when reading from Firestore.

    • EventModel

      public EventModel(com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore db)
      Constructs a new EventModel with the Firestore database instance.

      This constructor initializes the event's title, facility ID, description, number of spots, event type, and poster image with default values. It also generates a QR code for the event and saves the event data to Firestore.

      Parameters:
      db - the Firestore database instance used to store event data

    • EventModel

      public EventModel(String title, String description, int numberOfSpots, Date startDate, Date endDate, boolean geo, EventState state, com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore db)
      Constructor to create an EventModel instance. Automatically generates a QR code and initializes the Firestore database instance.
      Parameters:
      title - the title of the event
      description - a description of the event
      numberOfSpots - the number of spots available for the event
      db - the Firestore database instance

    • EventModel

      public EventModel(String title, String description, int numberOfSpots, int numberOfMaxEntrants, Date startDate, Date endDate, boolean geo, EventState state, com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore db)

    • EventModel

      public EventModel(String title, String description, int numberOfSpots, int numberOfMaxEntrants, Date startDate, Date endDate, String posterImage, boolean geo, String qrCodeUrl, EventState state, com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore db)
      Constructor to create an EventModel instance. Automatically generates a QR code and initializes the Firestore database instance.
      Parameters:
      title - the title of the event
      description - a description of the event
      numberOfSpots - the number of spots available for the event
      db - the Firestore database instance

    • saveEventToFirestore

      public void saveEventToFirestore(com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<String> onSuccess)
      Saves the event data to Firestore. If the event has already been saved, this method does nothing.

      public void removeEventFromFirestore()
      Removes the event data to Firestore. If the event has already been removed, this method does nothing.

    • getWaitingList

      public ArrayList<String> getWaitingList()
      Retrieves the list of users on the waiting list for this event.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of UserModel objects representing the waiting list

    • doDraw

      public void doDraw()
      Does the initial random draw from the waiting list of this event. Places winners and losers in their appropriate Firebase collections.

    • doReplacementDraw

      public void doReplacementDraw()
      Does the replacement draw from the waiting list of this event. Places winners into correct Firebase collection, and removes from not selected collection.
